chapter.title: Monitoring
chapter.para: Monitoring is an important part of any piece of software.

section.title: Recollecting Stats
section.para:
By default, DefaultGnipFacade stream's collects stats about the state of the stream.
These are the collected metrics:
Transfered Bytes
Last Transfered Bytes Date
Transfered Activities
Last Transfered Activities Date
Number of reconnection attempt
Last reconnection attempt Date
Number of successful reconnections
Last successful reconnection Date

section.title: JMX
section.para: The stream stats is exported using JMX by default (if platform supports it). These stats are located in the MBean named com.zaubersoftware.gnip4j.streams.DDDDDDD-ID where DDDDDDD is the stream domain, and ID is the collector's id.
JMX monitoring can be turned off using facade.setUseJMX(false).
